resources.string:
Characterization on the basis of absolute value of total power of spectrum (TP).

  • If TP<300ms2, reserves of energy are exhausted (expressed asthenoneurotic state; needs: urgent restoration of “vital powers”, choice of optimal regime in work and rest, compensation of main disease’s development);
  • if TP is 300-700ms2, reserves of energy are reduced essentially (asthenia, the state is accompanied with reduction of creative potential and ability to work; time and resources needed for restoration during diseases increase significantly, hipoergic reactions are typical);
  • if TP is 700-1500ms2, reserves of energy are reduced (tendency to asthenia and reduction of ability to work);
  • if TP is 1500-3000ms2, reserves of energy are within norm (optimal regime of functioning);
  • ); if TP is 3000-4000ms2, reserves of energy are increased (good level of stamina, formation of adaptation’s reserves);
  • if TP is 4000-6000ms2, reserves of energy are increased significantly (state of excessive reactions – hiperergia; there is necessity in restoration of balance in energy consumption);
  • ); if TP>6000ms2, reserves of energy are excessive (significant imbalance in consumption of vital powers, state of vegetative dysfunction).

As the favorite children’s question “What is stronger: elephant or whale?” is not correct, so it is here: a person with high value of total power of spectrum is not always tougher than a person with lower value of TP. But values of the same person should be compared: if his value of TP is higher today than yesterday, it means that he has rested well and gained power. But if his TP value has become lower, it means that today is not his day.

Characterization on basis of diapasons of absolute values of HF, LF, VLF.

HF

  • If HF<300ms2, the level of recovering potential is low.
  • If HF is 300-700ms2, the level of recovering potential is moderate.
  • If HF>700ms2, the level of recovering potential is high.

LF

  • If LF<300ms2, the level of mobilizing potential is low.
  • If LF is 300-700ms2, the level of mobilizing potential is low.
  • If LF>700ms2, the level of mobilizing potential is high.

VLF

  • If VLF<700ms2, the level of hormonal modulation of regulatory mechanisms is low.
  • If VLF is 700-1300ms2, the level of hormonal modulation of regulatory mechanisms is moderate.
  • If VLF>1300ms2, the level of hormonal modulation of regulatory mechanisms is high.

HF is diapason which reflects activity of reflex systems of regulation, restoring energy potential of organs and systems.

LF is diapason which reflects activity of reflex systems of regulation; if activity of these systems lasts much time, exhaustion of energy resources of organs and systems occurs.

А VLF is diapason which reflects work of vasomotor center and humoral mechanisms of regulation.

Everything is clear here. Predominance is there, where the number is higher. It is just needed to note that the norm is considered to be the following ratio: LF/HF≈ 1.5–2. If the coefficient exceeds 2, it manifests that the person is too mobilized. When mobilization occurs during working (load), it is well; but if the person is always too active, there is nothing good here. Another extreme position is significant relaxation, when LF/HF<1. It is normal condition for a tired person, when his body is in the regime of rest. But there are reasonable limits in relaxation.

string-array.name: center_array
string-array.item: The process of physiological functions’ regulation is characterized by predominance of autonomy (segmental) influences in management, reflecting optimal functioning of system.

The process of physiological functions’ regulation is characterized by predominance of central influences in management, reflecting tension in functioning of system and tendency to duplication of control over processes.
Balance in systems of management.

resources.string:
Characterization on basis of index of centralization (IC).

IC is calculated with the help of the following formula: IC=(HF+LF) / VLF. It reflects balance between activity of segmental and supra-segmental contours of vegetative management. It becomes higher in case of increased autonomy impacts. In other words, this index answers the question whether vegetative nervous system (LF, HF) is able to carry out function of management over heart rate, or vasomotor center and humoral mechanisms of regulation (VLF) help it to fulfill the function.

If IC>1, the process of physiological functions’ regulation is characterized by predominance of autonomy (segmental) influences in management, reflecting optimal functioning of system. In this case, share of VLF-diapason occupies less than half of area on circle chart “Spectral power of diapasons”.

If IC<1, the process of physiological functions’ regulation is characterized by predominance of central influences in management, reflecting tension of system’s functioning and tendency to duplication of control over processes. In this case, share of VLF-diapason occupies more than half of area on circle chart “Spectral power of diapasons”.

Let’s mention certain details: share of VLF in healthy young persons is usually 1/4 - 1/3 of circle chart, while half of circle chart (IC=1) is a norm for persons who are about 50 years old. It means that index of centralization is tightly connected with aging processes. It also reflects how poorly reflex mechanisms (vegetative nervous system) carry out their functions.

resources.string:
Characterization on basis of Baevski’s index of tension (IN).

  • If IT<30, there is state of expressed distress with predominance of stress-limiting systems’ activity.
  • If IT=30-60, there is state of compensated distress with tendency to predominance of stress-limiting systems’ activity.
  • If IT=60-120, there is state of eustress (optimum of adaptation from position of physiological regulation).
  • If IT=120-200, there is state of tension in adaptation mechanisms with tendency to enhancement of stress-realizing systems’ activity.
  • If IT>200, there is state of expressed stress with possibility of damaging influence on systems and organs by excessive activity of stress-realizing systems.
